Vocabulary.Name: Clickstream
Vocabulary.Comment: Vocabulary for describing clickstream (website traffic) events.

Term.Comment: Event for an HTTP request and response
Event that represents a single clickstream page view
Event that represents a single clickstream visitor session
Clickstream session group this event was assigned to
Unique identifier assigned to the clickstream visitor session
Unique identifier assigned to the visitor (across sessions)
Unique identifier assigned to a http request (in storage)
Cookie identifier used for sessionizing clickstream ("name:value")
Page sequence number, or total number of pages for session events
Request sequence number, or total number of requests for session and page view events
Page title, extracted from HTML content
Response content (normally HTML) for the http-event which triggered the new page-event
Date of the request (2008-07-20)
Time of the request (12:20:21)
Date and time of the request (2008-07-20 12:20:21)
Number of seconds since the epoch (January 1, 1970)
Date and time of the request (CLF format)
Date and time of the first request packet (20080720T122021.123213)
Date and time of the last request packet (20080720T122021.123213)
Date and time of the first response packet (20080720T122021.123213)
Date and time of the last response packet (20080720T122021.123213)
IP address of the closest proxy server in dot-quad notation
IP address of the client in dot-quad notation
IP address of the server in dot-quad notation
Client packets MAC address in hexadecimal format
Server packets MAC address in hexadecimal format
Client port number for the HTTP request
Server port number for the HTTP request
The total number of packets sent from client to server
The total number of packets sent from server to client
The number of acknowledgement packets sent from client to server
The number of acknowledgement packets sent from server to client
The number of missing packet gaps detected within the request
The number of missing packet gaps detected within the response
The number of duplicate packets sent from client to server
The number of duplicate packets sent from server to client
The number of data packets sent from client to server
The number of data packets sent from server to client
The number of bytes sent from client to server
The number of bytes sent from server to client
The total number of bytes transferred
The HTTP status code returned to the client
The HTTP status message returned to the client
The HTTP method of the request (GET, POST, etc.)
The requested resource (including query)
The requested resource (excluding query)
The query portion of the requested resource
The request line exactly as it came from the client
The Host HTTP request header
The Referer HTTP request header
The User-Agent HTTP request header
The Cookie HTTP request header
The Set-Cookie HTTP response header
The Content-Type HTTP response header
Payload content sent from client to server
Payload content sent from server to client
The remote logname of the user
The username as which the user has authenticated himself
1 if the response was cached, 0 if it was not
1 if the event was generated by a robot visitor, undefined if it was not
1 if the http-event triggered the generation of a new page
1 if the (http or page) event triggered the generation of a new visitor session
Number of microseconds that it took to complete an HTTP event, from the end user's perspective
Number of microseconds that it took the client to send an HTTP request
Number of microseconds that it took the server to acknowledge receipt of the HTTP request
Number of microseconds that it took the server to start replying to an HTTP request
Number of microseconds that it took the server to send an HTTP response
Number of microseconds that it took the client to acknowledge receipt of the HTTP response
Number of microseconds that it took to negotiate an SSL handshake
Number of microseconds from the last request packet to the last response packet
Average round trip time in microseconds from the client to the Pion server
Average round trip time in microseconds from the Pion server to the protocol server
Sum of all round trip time measurements from the client to the Pion server
Sum of all round trip time measurements from the Pion server to the protocol server
Number of round trip time measurements from the client to the Pion server
Number of round trip time measurements from the Pion server to the protocol server
Number of microseconds that it took to load a page view
Number of microseconds that it took redirecting a page view
Number of microseconds that it took loading a page's HTML
Number of microseconds that it took loading a page's content
Number of HTTP requests associated with the page view
Number of seconds spent viewing a completed page view
Number of page views associated with a visitor session
Number of HTTP requests associated with a visitor session
Number of seconds spent viewing all pages within a visitor session
Number of seconds between the first and last session requests
The Internet service name and instance number that was running on the client
The name of the server on which the log file entry was generated
The HTTP substatus error code
The Windows status code
The protocol version that the client used
ContentStorage compressed
